evidence: Rule one: The two input terminals are at the same voltage.
triples.o: two input terminals at the same voltage

concepts.term: the two input terminals are at the same voltage
input impedance of an op amp is extremely high

evidence: Even though an operational amplifier is an active component, the basic circuit laws still apply - Kirchhoff's Current Law and Kirchhoff's Voltage Law always hold.
But for op amps, we have two special rules that make analysis much easier: Rule one: The two input terminals are at the same voltage.
Rule two: No current flows into either input terminal.
The input impedance of an op amp is extremely high - ideally infinite - so no measurable current enters the inputs.
